author: Jern92
title: Livi's Oddly Life-threatening House
review:
I enjoyed the build more than I thought I would.

Very cute fully-equipped kitchen inside, plenty of windows and large transparent pieces, and a cool feature of having sliding doors for the house.

It's a bit small, but I guess most of the newer Lego sets are. RM279 for 597 pieces, which I personally think is great value because of all the large bricks and transparent bricks you get.

On the downside, the mini dolls have trouble sitting. They keep falling off the poolside lounger and the float in the middle of the pool (I've lost count of how many times Livi drowned because of this).

There's also a security camera trained at the pool area, so perhaps Livi enjoys filming her friends playing in the pool?

The roof also oddly covers only half the building, which means Livi doesn't even need water in her toilet; she could just wait for rain.

Also since there are no back walls, there's the risk of her slipping in the shower and falling down the stairs into the pool below. Poor Livi; she sure needs a less life-threatening house.

Overall, this has been a fun set to build with plenty of play features ('Livi making breakfast!' 'Livi making secret videos of her friends in the pool!' 'Livi slipping and falling in the shower into the pool!'). Get it if you enjoy recreating the secret life of Livi the pop star!
